item.title: Bonus, Stock Split Alert: ITC demerger, Shriram Finance share division key events - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Key Corporate Actions: ITC Demerger and Shriram Finance Stock Split

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: CNBC TV18

As the earnings season approaches, significant corporate actions occur next week, including the ITC demerger and Shriram Finance stock split.

  • ITC Demerger: Record date fixed for January 6; shareholders receive one hotel share for every 10 ITC shares.
  • Algoquant Fintech: A bonus issue of 1:2; record date is January 8.
  • Camlin Fine Sciences: Rights issue to raise ₹225 crore; record date is January 8.
  • Jagsonpal Pharma: Share split from ₹5 to ₹2 each; record date is January 8, 2025.
  • Shriram Finance: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹2 each; record date is January 10.
“The record date for ITC's demerger has been fixed as January 6. Shareholders will be eligible for hotel business shares.”

This week marks critical corporate restructuring events that may influence stock prices and trading patterns significantly.

item.title: Stocks To Watch Today: ITC, HDFC Bank, Dabur, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Marico, Bajaj Housing Finance And More - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stocks To Watch Today: ITC, HDFC Bank, Dabur, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Marico, Bajaj Housing Finance And More

Date & Source: January 5, 2025, BloombergQuint

Your guide to the most important stocks that will be on radar in Monday's trading session.

  • ITC: The stock will go ex-trade for demerger. ITC Hotels will be demerged from the parent company.
  • HDFC Bank: Strong performance with total advances growing by 3% and deposits increasing by 15.8% YoY.
  • Dabur India: Anticipated low single-digit growth in the third-quarter revenue.
  • Bank of Baroda: Deposits rose 9.23% year-on-year to Rs 11.66 lakh crore.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank: COO and CTO Milind Nagnur resigned.
  • Brigade Enterprises: Signed agreement for a major residential project in Bengaluru.
  • Marico: Revenue delivered mid-teen growth with modest profit expectations.
  • Bank of India: Reports 13.3% growth in domestic deposits.
  • DCX Systems: Received an export order worth Rs 483 crores.
  • Bajaj Housing Finance: Assets under management grew by 26% YoY.
  • L&T Finance: Retail loan book rose by 23% YoY.
  • NTPC Green Energy: Secured a project in UPPCL’s solar auction.

This trading session will be influenced by the performance of these key stocks and their latest updates.

item.title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to US dollar; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Monday — 6 January, 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to US dollar; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Monday — 6 January, 2025

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Live Mint

The domestic stock market indices closed lower on January 3, with profit booking amid weak global cues. The Nifty 50 dropped to 24,004.75 points, and the BSE Sensex fell to 79,223.11 points. Experts provided insights on the outlook for the Nifty 50 and recommended five stocks to consider for trading.

Key Points:

  • Nifty 50 index closed down 0.76% and BSE Sensex down 0.90%.
  • Market sentiment remains cautiously positive with anticipation of further rises.
  • Parekh highlighted crucial resistance and support levels for Nifty and Bank Nifty.
  • US Dollar Index was trading lower, affecting commodity prices.
  • Experts recommended stocks including Titan Company, Authum Investment, GAIL India, Shriram Finance, and Aditya Birla Capital.

Notable Quotes:

“The index would have the important support near the 200 period MA at 23,900 levels which needs to be sustained.” - Market Expert
“TITAN presents a promising buying opportunity with a target of ₹3,693.” - Stock Analyst

In conclusion, the stock market indicates cautious trading with potential for upward movements in selected stocks amid ongoing monitoring of global factors.

item.title: Stocks in news: ITC, HDFC Bank, Adani Wilmar, Kotak Bank, HUL - The Economic Times
item.description:
Stocks in news: ITC, HDFC Bank, Adani Wilmar, Kotak Bank, HUL

Date & Source: January 6, 2024, ETtech

Indian markets faced selling pressure, with various shares in focus due to recent news developments. Notable companies include ITC, HDFC Bank, Adani Wilmar, and Hindustan Unilever.

  • ITC: The demerger of ITC Hotels took effect as of January 1, with January 6 as the record date.
  • Union Bank: Reported a 2% YoY increase in domestic deposits, totaling Rs 11.82 lakh.
  • Adani Wilmar: Revenue grew by 33% YoY for the December quarter.
  • HDFC Bank: Gross advances increased by 3% YoY to Rs 25.42 lakh crore.
  • HUL: Advanced discussions to acquire skincare startup Minimalist for Rs 3,000 crore.
“Bandhan Bank's loans and advances rose 15% YoY to Rs 1.33 lakh crore.”

This period demonstrates fluctuations in market performance and strategic movements by major companies affecting their stock responses.

item.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds below $2,650 as traders await fresh catalysts - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds below $2,650 as traders await fresh catalysts

Date: December 2023 | Source: FXStreet

The Gold price (XAU/USD) remains steady around $2,640 amid stronger US manufacturing data and ongoing geopolitical tensions. Analysts are looking towards upcoming US labor market data for further direction.

  • Gold price holds steady around $2,640 in Monday’s early Asian session.
  • US Manufacturing PMI improved to 49.3 in December vs. 48.4 prior, stronger than expected.
  • Sustained geopolitical risks and a wave of purchases by central banks could lift the Gold price.

“Central banks are forecast to continue to be net buyers of around 8 million oz. in 2025.”

Overall, the stability in Gold prices reflects a combination of market dynamics, including central bank purchasing patterns and geopolitical uncertainties, making it a pivotal asset for investors during turbulent times.

item.title: NPS systematic withdrawal plan suits retirees with large corpus - The Times of India
item.description:
NPS Systematic Withdrawal Plan Benefits Retirees

Publication Date: Recently | Source: Times of India

The National Pension System (NPS) offers a systematic withdrawal plan particularly beneficial for retirees with a substantial corpus.

  • The systematic withdrawal plan allows retirees to withdraw funds periodically instead of a lump sum.
  • This mechanism aids in financial planning by ensuring a steady income stream post-retirement.
  • Retirees can customize their withdrawal frequency and amount based on their needs.
  • This option is particularly advantageous for those with larger retirement savings, enabling better cash flow management.
“The systematic withdrawal plan is tailored to meet the diverse financial needs of retirees, providing flexibility and security.”

The NPS's systematic withdrawal plan not only secures financial stability for retirees but also encourages a more strategic approach to managing retirement funds.

item.title: Standard Glass Lining IPO GMP today percentage gain of share price band, listing date - DETAILS - ET Now
item.description:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Launch Details and Expected Gains

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: ET NOW

Standard Glass Lining Technology is set to launch its IPO on January 6, 2025, with a closing date of January 8, 2025. The IPO aims to raise Rs 410 crore and is expected to generate notable gains based on current grey market prices.

  • The IPO includes a fresh issue of shares worth up to Rs 210 crore and an offer for sale of 1,42,89,367 equity shares.
  • The price band for the shares is set between Rs 133 and Rs 140.
  • Currently, shares are trading at a grey market premium (GMP) of Rs 97, indicating a 69.29% gain potential over the issue price.
  • The allotment date for shares is scheduled for January 9, 2025, with the listing expected on January 13, 2025.
"The company aims to use the proceeds for capital expenditure, debt repayment, and strategic investments."

This IPO is generating significant interest among investors, highlighting the company's strong market position and financial stability.

item.title: Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Bloomberg

Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. incurred a loss of approximately ¥140 billion ($890 million) by selling long-term bonds in anticipation of rising interest rates. The company sold ¥500 billion in Japanese government bonds, primarily of longer maturities, in the first half of the fiscal year.

  • The sales were concentrated in the first half of the fiscal year, with plans for more restrained activity in the second half.
  • President Toshiaki Sumino assured that the loss would not impact the company's financial soundness.
  • Dai-ichi Life holds ¥18.9 trillion in yen-denominated bonds.
  • Sumino predicts a rate hike by the Bank of Japan due to the economy showing signs of recovery.
  • The company is focused on replacing sold assets while being mindful of profit impacts.
  • Annualized premiums from new contracts rose significantly in the first half of fiscal 2024, marking a recovery from previous scandals.
“I don’t think the loss will have any impact on our financial soundness,” said Sumino.

Overall, Dai-ichi Life is navigating the challenges posed by the changing interest rate environment while also working to rebound from past setbacks.

item.title: Chinese hack of US telecoms compromised more firms than previously known, WSJ says - The Economic Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Vinay Hiremath, co-founder of Loom, expressed confusion after selling his startup for $975 million, revealing his struggles with newfound wealth and direction in life.

  • Hiremath sold Loom to Atlassian for $975 million in 2023.
  • He shared his thoughts in a blog post, detailing feelings of aimlessness despite financial freedom.
  • He apologized to his ex-girlfriend, reflecting on personal insecurities affecting his relationships.
  • He considered starting a robotics company but felt uninspired by the idea.
  • Hiremath attempted to work for Elon Musk, describing it as a valuable experience.
  • After an ill-fated expedition in the Himalayas, he is currently in Hawaii learning physics to build a foundation for future ventures.
“After selling my company, I find myself in the totally un-relatable position of never having to work again.”

Hiremath’s journey highlights the emotional challenges that can accompany sudden wealth and the search for purpose beyond financial success.

item.title: Expert take | 'Private banks, IT and pharma sectors seen attractive for 2025,' says Geojit Fin Services' Vinod Nair | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Private Banks, IT, and Pharma Sectors Expected to Thrive in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The article discusses the outlook for the stock market in 2025, emphasizing the attractiveness of private banks, IT, and pharma sectors despite potential challenges such as elevated valuations and reduced liquidity.

  • Domestic stock markets may face challenges but investment opportunities remain due to economic performance.
  • Capital preservation and high-quality stocks will be key investment themes.
  • Private banks are expected to benefit from GDP growth and low valuations.
  • IT and pharma sectors are favored due to stable business outlooks and dollar strength.
  • Consumer sectors face headwinds, but FMCG could benefit from favorable conditions.
  • Infrastructure and textiles sectors show strong growth potential.
The author, Vinod Nair, states, "Value stocks and high dividend payers will be a big theme of 2025."

In conclusion, while challenges exist, strategic investments in key sectors could yield positive outcomes in 2025.

item.title: What is the salary of Apple's new Indian-origin CFO Kevan Parekh? Details here - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Apple's New CFO Kevan Parekh: Salary and Background Details

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the appointment of Kevan Parekh as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Apple Inc., effective January 1, 2025, along with details of his salary and professional background.

  • Kevan Parekh's annual salary is set at $1 million (₹8.57 crore).
  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and held previous roles in financial planning and analysis.
  • He succeeds Luca Maestri as part of a planned transition.
  • Parekh has extensive experience with Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Apple's CEO Tim Cook praised Parekh's intellect and judgment in his appointment announcement.
“For more than a decade, Kevan has been an indispensable member of Apple's finance leadership team...” - Tim Cook

Parekh's leadership is expected to steer Apple's financial strategies effectively as he steps into this significant role.

item.title: Etihad Airways flight aborts takeoff at Melbourne airport after tyre burst, passengers evacuated safely - The Times of India
item.description:
Etihad Airways Flight Abort Soaring at Melbourne Airport Due to Tyre Burst

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

An Etihad Airways flight had to abort its takeoff at Melbourne Airport after experiencing a tyre burst, leading to the safe evacuation of passengers.

  • The incident occurred during takeoff.
  • All passengers were evacuated safely without injury.
  • The flight's safety protocols were effectively executed.
“Safety is our top priority and our team acted quickly to ensure all passengers were unharmed.”

The swift action taken ensured the safety of all onboard, highlighting the importance of aircraft safety measures.

item.title: Stocks To Watch on January 6: HDFC Bank, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Vedanta and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks To Watch on January 6: HDFC Bank, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Vedanta and More

Date: January 6, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to monitor in the trade on January 6, including significant updates and announcements from various companies.

  • HDFC Bank: Reported a year-on-year growth in gross advances by 3% and deposits by 15.8%; however, CASA deposits decreased by 4.4%.
  • ITC: Record date for ITC Hotels demerger where shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank: CTO and COO Milind Nagnur has resigned, effective February 15, 2025.
  • ICICI Bank: Received a GST demand and penalty order of ₹100.76 crore from Maharashtra's GST Department.
  • Bajaj Finance: Announced a business update with AUM growing by 28% year-on-year.
  • Vedanta: Production increased by 3% in Q3 FY25 with record-high mined metal production.
  • Premier Explosives: A fire in Telangana factory resulted in one fatality and severe injuries.
  • NTPC Green: Secured 1000 MW capacity in a bid at ₹2.56 per kWh from UPPCL.
  • Andhra Paper: Production disrupted due to a workers' strike at its Rajahmundry plant.
  • UCO Bank: Reported a 16.2% increase in total advances in Q3 FY25.
  • Quess Corp: Announced an income tax refund of ₹124.80 crore for FY24.

item.title: Adani Wilmar to expand FMCG portfolio, emulates ITC post-Adani group exit - Business Standard
item.description:
Adani Wilmar to Expand FMCG Portfolio, Emulating ITC Post-Adani Group Exit

Publication Date: N/A Source: Business Standard

Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL), India's largest edible oil company, is adopting a strategy akin to ITC's to bolster its FMCG portfolio following the exit of the Adani group. By leveraging its dominant edible oil business and extensive distribution network, AWL aims to achieve growth in high-margin FMCG products.

  • AWL's FMCG segment achieved a 24% year-on-year growth in volume in the December quarter.
  • The overall share of food and FMCG in volumes increased to 20%, and in revenues to 9%.
  • Key packaged products in the food category saw robust double-digit growth.
  • AWL's significant distribution network reaches 2.1 million outlets.
  • Due to higher oil prices, revenue from the edible oil segment increased by 39% year-on-year.
  • AWL's total revenues grew by 33%, surpassing analysts' expectations.
  • Gautam Adani's group sold its entire stake in AWL for over USD 2 billion.
“Our integrated distribution model is helping us capitalise on the strength of our oil distribution network to expand the reach of our food products, particularly in urban markets.”

With these strategic moves, AWL plans to introduce global FMCG brands into the Indian market, following the exit of the Adani Group.

item.title: Petrol Pump booked for delivering deficit fuel to consumers in Anantnag - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Petrol Pump in Anantnag Penalized for Deficient Fuel Delivery

Date: Jan 05, 2023 Source: Greater Kashmir

A petrol pump on National Highway Anantnag has been booked for delivering less fuel to consumers following a surprise inspection by the Enforcement unit of Legal Metrology Anantnag.

  • The inspection revealed that every 5 litres delivered was short by 30 ml.
  • The display boards at the petrol pump were found to be inaccurate.
  • The nozzle was seized, and prosecution under the Legal Metrology Act has begun against the pump owner.
  • Consumers are encouraged to check fuel delivery using a verified 5 litre measure, which should be visible at all petrol pumps.
  • Consumer rights awareness was promoted in the local community, with a toll-free number provided for complaints.
“Accuracy in the quantity of goods or fuel is the basic right of consumers.”

Consumers in the area appreciated the enforcement action and have been informed about their rights to ensure fair delivery of fuel.

item.title: Post-Adani exit, Wilmar to emulate ITC; leverage cash-cow oil business to expand FMCG portfolio - The Economic Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: HDFC Bank's LDR falls below 100% for the first time after merger - Business Standard
item.description:
HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

HDFC Bank's loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) has fallen below 100% for the first time since its merger with HDFC Ltd. This decline is attributed to slower loan growth and the securitisation of a significant portion of loans in Q3 of FY25.

  • HDFC Bank’s LDR is now at 99.2%, down from 100.76% in Q2 of FY25.
  • The LDR was 111.53% in Q3 of 2023-24.
  • The decrease is in line with the bank’s guidance for more cautious loan growth.
"The easing of the LDR aligns with the bank’s guidance, which indicated that it would grow its loan book more cautiously."

This drop below the critical 100% mark signifies a strategic shift in HDFC Bank’s approach to lending post-merger.

item.title: Pi Network Price to Triple Amid Migration Deadline Announcement - CoinGape
item.description:
Pi Network Price to Triple Amid Migration Deadline Announcement

Publication Date: January 5, 2025
Source: Coingape

The PI Network has received a significant price boost following the confirmation of its Open Mainnet launch in Q1 2025, generating excitement among traders and investors.

  • PI Network price had previously been consolidating under $50.
  • The Open Mainnet launch date was moved back to Q1 2025, promising expanded usability for Pi coins.
  • PI price surged 6% to $49 after the announcement on January 5.
  • The migration deadline for KYC submissions and Mainnet migration has been extended to January 31, 2025.
  • Analysts predict potential price gains up to 265% with a breakout above $67.
“If the upward trajectory persists, PI could see a significant price surge in the coming weeks, potentially tripling its value.”

The recent updates about the PI Network are set to enhance its utility and are receiving positive responses from the market, indicating a potentially bullish trend ahead.

item.title: Upcoming Tata Cars Launching This Year – Tiago Facelift To Harrier EV - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Upcoming Tata Cars Launching This Year - Tiago Facelift To Harrier EV

Date & Source: October 2024, Gaadi Waadi

Tata Motors is looking to enrich its lineup with several launches, focusing on both electric vehicles and facelifted versions of existing models in 2025.

  • The Harrier EV will debut at the 2025 Bharat Mobility Expo.
  • Facelifts for the Tiago and Tigor are expected, introducing new features and design updates.
  • The Sierra EV and its ICE version are also in the pipeline for release.
  • The Punch facelift, incorporating modern tech, is anticipated soon.
“The electric version of the Harrier has been in the development phase for a long time now.”

The upcoming Tata cars aim to cater to the growing demand for electric vehicles while updating existing models to meet customer expectations.

item.title: United Airlines accelerates its Starlink rollout, with first commercial flight planned for spring - TechCrunch
item.description:
United Airlines Accelerates Starlink Rollout with Upcoming Commercial Flight

Publication Date: September 17, 2024

Source: TechCrunch

United Airlines has announced a swift timeline for the rollout of Starlink, aiming to enhance in-flight internet access for passengers. Testing will begin next month, with the first commercial flight expected this spring.

  • United Airlines will start testing Starlink in October 2024.
  • The first passenger flight featuring Starlink will take off in spring.
  • Starlink aims to enhance in-flight Wi-Fi, allowing streaming and gaming.
  • Free Wi-Fi will be available for MileagePlus members on all planes equipped with Starlink.
  • The airline expects to retrofit its entire regional fleet by the year’s end.
“It’s not only going to revolutionize the experience of flying United, but it’s also going to unlock tons of new partnerships and benefits for our members that otherwise wouldn’t be possible.” - Richard Nunn, CEO of United’s MileagePlus program

The implementation of Starlink represents a significant advancement in United Airlines' service, promising to improve passenger connectivity and enhance the flying experience.

item.title: Stocks to buy or sell: Dharmesh Shah of ICICI Securities suggests buying JK Cement tomorrow — 6 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy or sell: Dharmesh Shah of ICICI Securities suggests buying JK Cement tomorrow — 6 January 2025

Date: 6 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market indices experienced a decline as profit booking took place amidst challenging global economic indicators. ICICI Securities' Dharmesh Shah recommends buying JK Cement, highlighting the robust market outlook despite current challenges.

Key Points:

  • The Nifty 50 closed 0.76% lower at 24,004.75 points.
  • The BSE Sensex fell 0.90% to 79,223.11 points.
  • Increased volatility is expected amid upcoming earnings reports and government policy measures.
  • Shah suggests that buying on dips would be a viable strategy in quality stocks.
  • Specific stock recommendations include Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL) and JK Cement Ltd.
“However, the stock market remains a viable investment opportunity, underpinned by the robust performance of the economy,” - Vinod Nair, Head of Research at Geojit Financial Services.

In conclusion, while the market faces obstacles, analysts believe there are still promising investment opportunities available.

item.title: Earning Rs 48 crore per day, Indian-origin techie is world's highest paid person - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Indian-Origin Techie Jagdeep Singh Earns Rs 48 Crore Per Day

Published: 05 January 2025, 12:47 IST

This article highlights the astonishing earnings of Jagdeep Singh, who has become the highest-paid employee in the world with a daily income of Rs 48 crore. His achievements and career trajectory are also outlined.

  • Jagdeep Singh's annual salary is Rs 17,500 crore.
  • He is a founder of QuantumScape, an electric vehicle battery company.
  • Singh's daily earnings surpass the annual revenues of many large companies.
  • He previously worked at Hewlett-Packard and Sun Microsystems.
  • Singh has a BTech from Stanford University and an MBA from UC Berkeley.
  • QuantumScape focuses on solid-state battery technology for electric vehicles.
  • In February 2023, Singh stepped down as CEO of QuantumScape but continues as Chairman of the Board.
"His daily wage is greater than the annual revenue of many prominent companies."

Jagdeep Singh's remarkable financial success highlights the potential of innovative technology in transforming industries.

item.title: Trade Setup For Jan. 6: Nifty May Test 24,650 On Breakout Above 24,130 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Trade Setup For Jan. 6: Nifty May Test 24,650 On Breakout Above 24,130

Date: January 6, 2025
Source: Bloomberg Quint

The market analysis suggests that the NSE Nifty 50 is positioned for a potential breakout that could push it towards 24,650 if it surpasses the immediate resistance at 24,130. Analysts are carefully observing key support and resistance levels.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 24,004.75, down 183.90 points (0.76%).
  • Immediate support is noted at 23,900 with major resistance at 24,130.
  • A breakout above 24,130 could lead to a rise towards 24,650.
  • Profit booking has influenced market movements, but overall investor sentiment shows strength with the index above the 200-day moving average.
  • Foreign portfolio investors have turned net sellers, offloading stocks worth Rs 4,227.3 crore.
  • Domestic investors remain active buyers, accumulating stocks worth Rs 820.6 crore over the last 13 sessions.
"Technically, on the daily chart, the Nifty formed a red candle, indicating profit booking, while on the weekly chart, it formed a green candle, indicating overall strength." - Hrishikesh Yedve

The prospects for the Nifty index remain optimistic as long as it consistently holds above its support levels, encouraging a buy-on-dips approach.

item.title: 3 Revolutionary Products Set to Launch in 2025! - MotorOctane
item.description:
3 Revolutionary Products Set to Launch in 2025!

Date: TBD | Source: MotorOctane

2025 is expected to be a revolutionary year for the Indian automotive space, with new petrol, CNG, ethanol, and EVs launching. Here are three unique cars launching in 2025.

  • Vayve Eva: A new electric quadricycle with a claimed range of 250 km and rooftop solar panels.
  • Hero Surge S32 Electric: An innovative scooter-three-wheeler concept designed for last-mile mobility.
  • Ligier Myli: A budget EV with a rumored range of up to 192 km.
“Which of these 3 models are you most excited for?”

This year promises to bring significant changes in the automotive market with these innovative launches aiming to reshape mobility.

item.title: Govt to switch on massive subsidy to supercharge EV infrastructure - Business Standard
item.description:
Govt to Switch on Massive Subsidy to Supercharge EV Infrastructure

Publication Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The central government is set to provide substantial subsidies to enhance EV charging infrastructure across the country.

  • 80% or higher subsidy on infrastructure for electric public fast charging stations.
  • Scheme named PM Electric Drive Revolution in Innovative Vehicle Enhancement (PM eDRIVE).
  • Funds allocated include Rs 581 crore for 48,400 fast chargers for electric two- and three-wheelers.
  • Support for a total of 72,300 fast charging stations nationwide.
“The subsidy could increase to 100% in exceptional cases.”

This initiative aims to significantly boost the deployment of electric vehicles by addressing charging infrastructure deficiencies.

item.title: Govt to give 80% subsidy for EV fast chargers under PM E-Drive scheme - Business Standard
item.description:
Govt to Give 80% Subsidy for EV Fast Chargers Under PM E-Drive Scheme

Publication Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The central government is launching a scheme to subsidize the installation of fast charging stations for electric vehicles, aiming to enhance the infrastructure for electric mobility across India.

  • The government will provide an 80% subsidy for setting up public fast charging stations.
  • The subsidy may increase to 100% under exceptional circumstances.
  • Funding is part of the Rs 2,000 crore PM Electric Drive Revolution scheme.
  • Support is earmarked for 48,400 fast chargers for two- and three-wheelers and 22,100 for electric vehicles.
The scheme aims to support 72,300 fast charging stations across the country.

This initiative is a significant step towards promoting electric vehicles in India, enhancing infrastructure, and reducing emissions.

item.title: NTPC Green Energy Share Price: 1000MW solar project from UPPCL! Time to BUY shares? Check target - ET Now
item.description:
NTPC Green Energy's 1000MW Solar Project: A Strong Investment Opportunity?

Updated: January 5, 2025 | Source: ET NOW News

NTPC Renewable Energy Limited has emerged as a successful bidder for a 1000 MW solar power project, securing a competitive tariff while awaiting the letter of award from UPPCL.

  • NTPC REL secured a capacity of 1000 MW at Rs 2.56/kWh.
  • Share price closed at Rs 128.35, showing a 0.35% increase on the BSE.
  • NTPC Renewable Energy began commercial delivery of 30 MW from its 150 MW solar plant in Gujarat.
"The market expert has given a BUY rating to the stock, with a target range of Rs 134-Rs 139 at the stop loss of Rs 120."

This significant project highlights NTPC's commitment to renewable energy and presents a promising investment opportunity in the changing energy landscape.
